body: People might see to be the openingThe flakes which have stolen onto the flagstonesI. Further Exploration of SpitsbergenCovering the landWhat can we know of whatever picture-planeSeized from creation by nonentity,Cascading snowflakes settle in the pines,I might have happily lived some other childhood.Is it almost honey, is it snow?Hoarfrost is in his bones and on his head,Some stubborn sprouts up through the stubble hay,Père and Mère Chose could be in conversationXI. Franklin's Last VoyageThe surge of swirling wind definesClose at the end of distance the two ChoseAnd then I go on until I am beneath an archway,shortcake, waffles, berries and creamAlberti, Brunelleschi, Sangallo,I.
